catalogue.message: Password has been changed.\nMake sure you give this new password to all system administrators.
The 3 fields must each contain a value.
Confirmation of the new password could not be carried out correctly.
An error has prevented any modification of password.\nMake sure that the old password is correct.
An error occured. The password has not been updated.

This screen allows you to change the application configuration.

Navigate through the top-right hand corner tabs and change parameters values.

The application will be automatically restarted after saving the changes.
The configuration has been correctly updated
Server is not responding or a fatal error occured during saving.\nConsult applications and servlet engines logfiles for more details.

An error occured on the server and parameters have not been updated.

Internal error message is :
One or more fields in the form are incorrect. Please modify them and then save the form.
This screen allows you to see the system state. It is divided into two tabs:

The tab 'General' allows you to monitor system status: memory, users...
This screen will refresh every 10 seconds.
The tab 'System properties' allows you to view the JVM system properties.
The tab 'Monitoring' allows you to view system state graphs.

Main memory is heap memory parameterized with -Xms and -Xmx options. For example -Xms128m -Xmx512m. When rolling over the memory bar with the mouse, a message will show the exact values of the memory.

Internal memory is the non-heap memory parameterized with -XX:MaxPermSize. For example -XX:MaxPermSize=128m. When rolling over the memory bar with the mouse, a message will show the exact values of the memory.
The given number indicates all servlet engine open sessions. No distinction is made, for example, between user and administrator sessions.
The given number indicates how many HTTP requests are being handled by the servlet engine (including the one used to determine that number).
The given number indicates all JVM threads (from all webapps).
An error occured. The memory may have not been freed and data are not up-to-date.\n\nThe screen won't refresh automatically anymore.
An error occured. Data are not up-to-date.\n\nThe screen won't refresh automatically anymore.

Unknown sessions count.

This message my be present if the server has just started. Please close your browser then reconnect.
 If you receive this message again, check that the 'WEB-INF/web.xml' file contains the following line under the root element:
<listener><listener-class>org.ametys.runtime.plugins.core.administrator.jvmstatus.SessionCountListener</listener-class></listener>

Unknown requests count.

Please check that the 'WEB-INF/web.xml' contains the following line under the root element: 
<listener><listener-class>org.ametys.runtime.plugins.core.administrator.jvmstatus.RequestCountListener</listener-class></listener>
Some threads are \"deadlocked\". CLick here to get a detailed report of the problem.
This graph displays the time since the application has started up. It will increase regularly but is reset to 0 each time the application is started.
This graph displays the number of HTTP requests executed during a sample of time.

This graph displays the running HTTP sessions count. A session is created each time a client connect (to the servlet engine in general and not particularly to this application) and is kept for X minutes after its last use (where X is a servlet engine configured value that worth 20 in general)

This graph displays the count of running java thread (shared between the whole servlet engine). A thread is a request processing or background task. By default, most servlet engine create X threads in prevision : most threads are just idle.

This graph displays the main memory use by the application. It is divided in 3 parts: total memory (that is the memory used at OS level, it grows to its maximal configured value but is never released, used memory (that is the memory really used by the applciation of the engine) and free memory (thath is the differnce between the two preceding and that is the memory given by the OS but not used by the application)
This graph displays the internal memory use. This memory is static and contains the libraries: it is never free and may only grow until all libraries are loaded.
This graph displays the processor use (works only with Sun JVM).
This graph displays the disk I/O operations over time (reads and writes).

This screen shows the list of loaded plugins and workspaces.

You can display 3 views by selecting the tab in the table of content:
Plugins view: this view matches the plugin's physical hierarchy.
Extension points view: this is a logical view where plugins are grouped by type.
Workspace view: this is a list of workspaces.

The button documentation allows you to see the documentation of the plugins. It is a contextual action, so you can select a specific node and click on documentation to see the specific part of the documentation.
(ERROR there is no reason for that feature to be inactive)

The change will be effective only when you will confirm all the changes.
To do so, please click on the 'Changes' action.

No graphical element of the plugins tree will be modified until you validate your changes.
You have the following waiting change(s):
Do you want to apply them now?

Be careful! The configuration changes can break your server.
The following file will be modified 'WEB-INF/param/runtime.xml'. If you have problems you can restore the backup copy 'WEB-INF/param/runtime.bak'.

Changing this file implies to restart the server (this will automatically be done whden you will apply your modifications).
Changes were applied and the server is restarting. Close this dialogue box to reload the page.

This screen allows you to display log files and remove obsolete ones.

If your log files are large and you are in production, remember to switch to 'ERROR' log level in 'WEB-INF\\log4j.xml' files.

You can also change log level temporally at runtime using the configuration button.
The file you are trying to display is large and cannot be sent without compression. Do you want to download the compressed file ?
Do you really want to delete selected log files ?\n\nThe delete process may fail if one a the selected files is currently in use.
A fatal error has occured on the server. The current page should be refreshed.
An error occured on the server. One or more files have not been deleted.\n\nThese files may be currently in use or have already been deleted. The current page should be refreshed.
Do you want to delete all files older than 12 days ?
An error occured on the server. The current page should be refreshed.

This screen allows you to modify for the runtime the log level category by category.

To modify permanently the log level you can configure the 'WEB-INF\\log4j.xml' file.
An error occured: modifications may not have been done.\nThe current page should be refreshed.
This screen enables a system announcement to be set up for users.
Do you really want to delete this announcement ?

Language code of the announcement message.
The language code consists of two letters (eg: fr, en, de, es, zh, etc.).
The special * character represents all other codes.
Announcement message in the specified language
Enter the announcement in the default language
The language always consist always of two letters.\nFor example: 'en' for english or 'fr' for french.
The message box cannot be empty.
An error occurred on the server. Modifications have not been saved.
Define temporary administrator(s) with all rights

Select the security protocol which will be used to send e-mails.
Bear in mind that the ports written here are the default ports and some mailing servers might use other values.
The user name. Leave blank if no authentication is required.
The user password. Leave blank if no authentication is required.

E-mail address used by default as the sender of the e-mails.
The Ametys.org <admin@ametys.org> form can be used.
E-mail address of the system administrator for alert purposes.
The same password has to be entered twice.\nPlease enter the new password in both boxes.
The value of this field is too long

Choose security level for the login form
-focus on user comfort: autocompletion on form fields, storing password in cookies
-focus on security: no storing of password, protection with a captcha
JDBC Driver fully qualified class name
JDBC URL for connecting to the database
User name for connecting to the database
Password associated with the user name for connecting to the database
The url of the LDAP server is invalid. It must be like 'ldap://server:389' or 'ldaps://server:389'.
Base DN for the entire LDAP directory
Absolute DN for LDAP directory super-user
Check this option to enable following references (mainly for dynamic groups).
Define the authentication method for LDAP directory
Select to use the secure LDAP (ldaps)
Set user interface in developer mode (CSS/JS not minified...)
Full developer mode (not concatenated, not minimized)

Check this box to deactivate XSLT stylesheets cache.
It is generally useless to disable this cache since the last modification dates of the xslt files are always checked.
By default (when false) the browser of the user is tested during its connection and the user redirected if its browser is not detected as compatible. Check this to remove this test.
The maximum size (in bytes) of uploaded files

Destination directory for uploaded files. You can use a path relative to your web application directory. The directory path must not end with the '/' character.
Samples: '/home/cms/data/uploads' or 'WEB-INF/data/uploads'.

This window allows to create or update users.

You may search for existing users.
Be careful : searches only return the 100 first results.

This window allows to display users.

You may search for existing users.
Be careful : searches only return the 100 first results.

The login ID must contains at least 3 characters and at most 16
The family name box cannot be empty.
The password box cannot be empty.

Unique login ID for user
3-64 characters (letters, digits or '_')

A group is a set of users. This enabled you to simultaneously assign the same tights to several users.

A profile consists of a set of rights. Each user is assigned a profile which grants particular rights.

Profiles can be added or edited, and rights assign in the bottom part of the screen.
